snippet: A federal appeals court panel on Thursday temporarily delayed plans for Idaho same-sex weddings while it considered the state’s request for a longer stay.
abstract: Federal appeals court panel temporarily delays plans for Idaho same-sex weddings while it considers state’s request for a longer stay; separately, Arkansas Judge Chris Piazza clears way for gay marriages to resume in Arkansas, expanding his ruling striking down a constitutional ban to also include the prohibition on clerks issuing same-sex marriage licenses.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court panel on Thursday temporarily delayed plans for Idaho same-sex weddings while it considered the state’s request for a longer stay.

headline.main: Gay Marriage Cases Revisited in Idaho and Arkansas
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage Cases Revisited in Idaho and Arkansas

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
